text: <@U13TWBRBL> I'm using fabric v0.6.1 via docker in production mode, I can deploy chaincode by peer command successfully. but failed when I do deploy operation with HFC. I found the log of docker container as below.

src/build-chaincode/hello.go:6:2: cannot find package "<http://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/chaincode/shim|github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/chaincode/shim>" in any of:
/opt/go/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/chaincode/shim (from $GOROOT)
/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/chaincode/shim (from $GOPATH)
It seams that the docker container has no fabric environment.
related containers' names are "jovial_chandrasekhar" and "serene_hypatia".
dev mode is no problem
docker image name is "b1d7277763ad".
<@U2LHDBZM0|abhisingh> has joined the channel

Hi, is there any example exist of event listener example (similar to <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/master/examples/events/block-listener>) but based on NodeJS SDK? I guess that this support has been added, here: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/commit/e9d3ac296de89a092b48990fd2e1b7bc4173a5c4>. Right?

attachments.title: node-SDK: add support for fabric events(block, chaincode, transactional) · hyperledger/fabric@e9d3ac2 · GitHub
attachments.text: This patch adds support for fabric events to the SDK. It defaults to the same timer based mechanism for transactional events if the app doesn't connect to a peer event source(eventHubConnect). Cha...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: node-SDK: add support for fabric events(block, chaincode, transactional) · hyperledger/fabric@e9d3ac2

text: <@U0N4P17ND> You can refer a sample program here `<https://github.com/ratnakar-asara/NodeSdkSample/tree/master/events>`
cool, thanks :+1:

<@U13Q594J2> I guess  public registerBlockEvent(callback:Function) (<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/v0.6/sdk/node/src/hfc.ts#L2980>) will register to each commited block, right? So it will be `EventType_BLOCK` right? And what is for public registerTxEvent(txid:string, callback:Function) <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/v0.6/sdk/node/src/hfc.ts#L2998>?  and what is txid parameter for?
<@U30DZDHDW|kroisin> has joined the channel
<@U0N4P17ND> sorry I am not really sure , didn't explored much on this. <@U0KQ9QKH6> could you help to comment on this
the txid parameter is the transaction id
this api is used by transaction context class to monitor status of a transaction and not generally used by others
thanks, so right now - we can listen to commited blocks and custom events, right?
I had some document patches for 0.6 that explained this but unfortunately they did not make the 0.6 cutoff
correct
hm.. but anyway could you share these documents? link to your github repo, gist any other way?
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1819/>
ls
<@U0KQ9QKH6> thanks

<@U2U9QNL6A> don’t believe your question above has been addressed, but that error is caused by the fact that you missed a pre-req step with the SDK, by adding the fabric source tree to the “vendor” folder next to your chaincode .go file
<@U0KQ9QKH6> by the way has been EventHub included into new <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-sdk-node>? - I see that it is mentioned in Readme.md but I don't see it in the sources...
<@U2U9QNL6A> refer to <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/v0.6/nodeSDK/node-sdk-indepth/> in the “Chaincode deployment” section

Done a fresh install and with hfc0.6.5 and fabric6. and get

 `Deploying chaincode ...`

`Failed to deploy chaincode: request={"fcn":"init","args":["a","100","b","200"],"chaincodePath":"chaincode","certificatePat
h":"/certs/peer/cert.pem"}, error={"error":{},"msg":"Error: Error creating deployment archive [/tmp/deployment-package.tar
.gz]: Error: Error on fs.createWriteStream"`

Working with SDK-DEMO running with Bluemix services.
<@U0N4P17ND> : no it has not. The support from the fabric side is not ready in 1.0
ok, got, it, thanks. Was hoping to dig more details form v1 :wink:
<@U13TWBRBL> I'd tried to do vendoring operations, but not worked. vendor init can make vendor.json, but vendor fetch can not make any changes.
